Job Title: Director of Operations

Location: Fresno County, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview

Founded in 1967, ImageFIRST is the largest healthcare linen rental and laundry services provider to medical facilities throughout the continental United States and Puerto Rico, with a specialty in serving the healthcare market.

Check out our company page: https://www.imagefirst.com/company/

Responsibilities & Qualifications

The primary focus of this position is to provide support in each plant in a Region, drive safety compliance and performance.

 Open to candidates from or willing to relocate to: Chicago, IL or Los Angeles, CA 

REMOTE - Travel requirement (75%)

 RESPONSIBILITIES: 

 Responsible for supporting the day to day operations of a region  Coach/Development of new Plant Managers  Ability to collaborate on startups and acquisitions  Drive daily process improvement in assigned territory.  Manage productivity reporting & performance for the assigned territory.  Work closely with Senior Management in developing long term operational strategies that meet the company’s objectives.  Ability to trouble shoot, problem solve and perform root cause analysis  Foster a safe work environment  Collaborate with cross functional departments on projects and new initiatives  Responsible for training and certification of all compliance areas 


 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 

 Minimum of 5 years’ experience in operations  Bachelor’s degree  Experience in a manufacturing environment  Six Sigma / Lean Manufacturing experience preferred.  Proven track record in managing multiple locations  Ability to trouble shoot, problem solve and perform root cause analysis  Travel requirement (75%)  Must thrive in a progressive environment  Strong organizational and presentation skills  Proficient with MS Office, Excel, Power Point, and general PC applications  Excellent leadership, interpersonal, and motivational skills.  Detail oriented with excellent follow-up, creativity, problem solving, conflict management, written and oral communication skills  Proven ability to drive performance without formal authority 


Company Values & Benefits

Required Competencies:

 Be Respectful: Value all we come in contact with  Be Remarkable: Create a positive moment with every interaction  Be Safe: Keep ourselves and those around us safe  Be Honest: Be guided by truthfulness in all we do 


Benefits:

 Weekly pay  Medical, Dental, Vision  Pet, Legal, and Hospital Indemnity Insurance  401k (match)  Paid Time Off Package  Tuition Reimbursement  Referral Program  Great company culture  Collaborative team environment 


EOE / Drug-Free Workplace

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are fueled by the talent, passion, and diversity of our associates.

#INDIF

Experience Level (if available): Director
